name: Ralof

aspects.trouble: Rebel Against an Empire That Won't Let Go

stunts: For Skyrim!: Once per scene, rally allies with a battle cry, granting all allies in zone +1 to attack for one exchange
Nord's Fury: +2 to Fight when fighting Imperial forces
Unbreakable Spirit: Once per session, automatically succeed on a Will roll to resist intimidation or continue fighting
notes: Ralof is a devoted Stormcloak soldier who recruits promising warriors to the rebellion cause. He's passionate about Skyrim's independence and the right to worship Talos. As Gerdur's brother, he has family connections in Riverwood. He's friendly and brotherhood-oriented, treating fellow Nords (and allies) like family. His combat style is aggressive and inspirational, rallying allies and striking fear into Imperial enemies. He believes the gods favor Skyrim's cause for freedom.
combat_tactics: Ralof fights aggressively and inspirationally. He leads charges, uses battle cries to motivate allies, and focuses on breaking enemy morale. He takes calculated risks and never backs down from Imperial forces. His presence boosts allied morale and coordination.
social_interaction: Ralof is warm, passionate, and fiercely loyal to those he considers friends. He speaks openly about Skyrim's right to independence and Talos worship. While he's dedicated to the Stormcloak cause, he's not blindly hateful - he respects honorable opponents and questions cruelty. He's protective of civilians and treats fellow Nords like extended family. He can be hotheaded when discussing the Empire or Thalmor, but he listens to friends he trusts.

relationships.Frodnar: Nephew, wants to protect his future
relationships.Imperial Legion: Enemies, tried to execute him unjustly
relationships.Thalmor: Hated oppressors, primary motivation for rebellion
relationships.General Tullius: Enemy commander, sees as foreign tyrant
relationships.Player: Recruited them to the cause, considers them battle-forged kin

personality_notes.speaking_style: Direct, passionate, uses Nordic expressions, frequently invokes Talos and Skyrim
fears: Skyrim becoming a Thalmor puppet state
quirks: Touches his Talos amulet when stressed
Speaks passionately of Skyrim's freedom and divine favor
Shares mead and stories enthusiastically with friends
personality_notes.character_growth: Can learn to see good Imperials as potential allies against Thalmor, develop more nuanced view of the war, become more strategic rather than purely passionate

companion_mechanics.recruitment_trigger: Player aligns with Stormcloaks or meets Ralof during recruitment

loyalty_increases.trigger: Visit Riverwood and check on family

loyalty_thresholds.80+: Will die for party, considers them true brothers/sisters, shares Stormcloak secrets
loyalty_thresholds.60-79: Trusted companion, fights fiercely alongside party
loyalty_thresholds.40-59: Professional but questioning loyalty, argues about party decisions
loyalty_thresholds.20-39: Considers leaving, refuses to fight Stormcloaks
loyalty_thresholds.0-19: Leaves party, may become enemy if party joins Imperials

companion_quests.name: Protecting Riverwood
companion_quests.description: Help Ralof protect Riverwood from bandits/Imperial scouts
companion_quests.reward: Ralof loyalty +10, Gerdur provides shelter and supplies

companion_quests.name: The Talos Legacy
companion_quests.description: Help Ralof find and protect hidden Talos shrine from Thalmor
companion_quests.reward: Blessing of Talos bonus, Ralof loyalty +15, unique Talos amulet

story_hooks: Ralof provides introduction to Gerdur in Riverwood, giving party access to lumber mill and supplies
His Stormcloak connections provide entry to Ulfric's court in Windhelm
Can share intelligence about Stormcloak strategy and movements
Personal stake in Battle of Whiterun - wants to liberate it for Skyrim
Strong anti-Thalmor sentiment makes him natural ally in disrupting Thalmor schemes
If loyalty is high, may provide advance warning of Stormcloak operations
whiterun_integration: In Whiterun, Ralof maintains contacts with Gray-Mane clan and other Nord traditionalists. During Battle of Whiterun, if fighting for Stormcloaks, he provides morale bonuses to party and allied troops. His presence makes Stormcloak-sympathetic NPCs more open. He can identify which Whiterun residents secretly support Ulfric.

dialogue_samples.greeting: Look who it is! My friend from the cause. We're fighting for Skyrim together - that makes us kin in my book.
dialogue_samples.combat_start: For Skyrim! Show these bastards what true Nords are made of!
dialogue_samples.low_health: By Talos, they'll have to do better than that! I won't fall again!
dialogue_samples.victory: That's how we do it! Skyrim's freedom is worth every drop of blood!
dialogue_samples.civil_war_discussion: The Empire? They're puppets dancing on Thalmor strings. They bent the knee and outlawed our gods. Skyrim belongs to the Nords, and we'll fight until we're free or dead. Those are the only two options I see.
dialogue_samples.personal: My sister Gerdur and her family... that's what I'm fighting for. I want my nephew Frodnar to grow up free, able to worship Talos openly, proud to be a Nord. The Empire wants to take that away. I can't let them.

variants.name: Ralof (Veteran)
variants.changes: After several battles: Increase Fight to Superb (+5), add mental stress box, add stunt 'War Hero: Once per session, inspire all allies in scene with +2 to all rolls for one exchange'
